content.description: Begin on lower angle face and climb past a single bolt to a flaring crack. Top out on a large ledge.  Bolted anchors well back from the edge
content.location: In the descent gully. Wugit is two climbs left of "In the Dark." Last line on climber's left side of the wall.

content.description: This short fingers to hand crack is fun, but short. The 8+ rating seems to be adequate, but is certainly not any harder and may deserve an 8.
content.protection: Single set of cams to 3".  There is NO ANCHOR, so in order to bring up a follower or TR you'll need a cordalette (2 for redundancy) to sling the top of the pinnacle and belay/lower safely.  Once done on the route you can scramble to the top and clean your cord by connecting a long sling to the nearby anchor on "Gentle Persuasion" and stepping across.  This is all a bit sketchy, and could be easily fixed by someone with a drill and knowledge of placing bolts.
content.location: Across the descent gully from the Guillotine Flake

content.description: This is a fun and steep sport climb!  Approach the first bolt from the left (the direct start boulder problem is v2, and also good).  The climbing is a bit difficult to read onsight.  I give this one 3 stars because i really like steep sport climbs that are also easy to top rope.  Good climb!
content.location: North side of the corridor (south facing).  Immediately right of: gentle persuasion.

content.description: This route climbs the face below and crosses the Guillotine Flake. Getting to the first bolt is a little spooky. Cams can be placed in the flake to avoid a ground fall. Getting to the second bolt is very committing and tricky. The crux lies above second bolt. There is a bolted anchor at top.
content.protection: Three bolts and Medium to large cams at flake. Bolted anchor at top.
content.location: This route lies at the mouth of the descent gully on the left side of the High Rappel Dell.

content.description: Crux is the third bolt. Really just one tricky move, but well protected.Always in the shade, save for warmer times. More easy than the 5.9 mantle a couple of routes down. My first 10 on lead.
content.protection: 4 bolts, belay anchors way back from the edge, if setting t.r. second rope or long  webbing like 40 or 50 Ft
content.location: left side of descent gully, if facing the wall, first climbing area coming from the parking area

climbs.name: In The Dark
climbs.fa: Leo Henson, Dale Rice, Mark Miller 1987

content.description: Face climb up a black streak. Sustained 5.10 climbing.
content.protection: 5 bolts.   2 bolt anchor at top, must be extended a long ways
content.location: In the Descent Gully, between Last Word and Empire Strikes Back

content.description: Obvious large flake on the left side of the crag, right next to a gully (descent gully).  start up akward offwidth, then traverse right on the flake, and finish up akward, but easy, wide crack.
content.protection: large pro for start and end, medium (2 and 3 camalots) for the traverse, and a few smaller cams.

content.description:
Up a couple easy first steps to some small holds on the featured face to first bolt. Continue straight up on more small holds and decent feet.  Crux is getting past the last bolt (third I think) to some sloping cracks between blocks near the top 

  Easy to set up a top rope with not much rope drag. You can also scramble to and from the top to climber's right
content.protection: Three (maybe just two) bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: On the north wall (south facing) of the descent gully. The left of two bolted lines on the wall

content.description: Climb up on the right side of the wall past two bolts to a shallow hand crack that quickly disappears. Clip another bolt past the crack and continue to a two bolt anchor about 20 feet back
content.protection: 3 bolts and one or two hand sized pieces. Two bolt anchor about 20 feet back
content.location: Near right side of the south wall. Somewhat below an obvious hand crack higher up the wall. On the descent gully

content.description: Up the blunt prow right of Guillotine. Start up to thin face climbing that leads to the top of the prow.
content.location: Just right of Guillotine, past the Descent Gully when approaching from the North.

climbs.name: Crack of Doom
climbs.fa: Mike Acebo first led this in '68 with no gear

content.description: Classic Dells off-width, follow obvious wide splitter on far left pillar. Start directly below the crack or take the variation from the right and traverse back left. Size of crack goes form finger to hand to off-width to tight chimney at the top.
content.protection: Small to large cams, with some off-width goodness like Big-Bros or large Camalots.
content.location: Farthest-left pillar on The Main Wall, obvious off-width. Walk off to the east to gain access to the Descent Gully.

content.description: Steep, slopey face climbing leads to a balancy mantle crux. Continue on interesting holds, then finish with slab climbing at the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor far back from the edge. Bring long an extra rope or extra-long webbing for setting up a top-rope.
content.location: On the South side of the descent gully. Furthest climb to the right before the arete.

content.description: This is a popular sport climbing area with great rock. The area is generally shady year round.
